intro: Galium spurium subsp. africanum, commonly known as African bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its herbaceous nature and delicate appearance make it a notable species within its native habitat.
